text:
<@UAUPJLBQX> I was going through <https://juliasimd.github.io/LoopVectorization.jl/stable/examples/matrix_multiplication/#Matrix-Multiplication|this>  example in the `LoopVectorization.jl`  documentation for matrix multiplication and I don't understand why, but it is not updating my `C` output matrix.
```N = 2
A1 = rand(N, N)
A2 = rand(N,N)
A3 = similar(A1)

function A_mul_B!(C, A, B)
    @avx for n ∈ indices((C,B), 2), m ∈ indices((C,A), 1)
        Cmn = zero(eltype(C))
        for k ∈ indices((A,B), (2,1))
            Cmn += C[m,k] * B[k,n]
        end
        C[m,n] = Cmn
    end
end

julia> A_mul_B!(A3, A1, A2)

julia> A3
2×2 Matrix{Float64}:
 6.22527e-310  9.15541e-310
 6.22543e-310  9.15553e-310```
Is this a bug?

elements.text: documentation for matrix multiplication and I don't understand why, but it is not updating my

N = 2
A1 = rand(N, N)
A2 = rand(N,N)
A3 = similar(A1)

function A_mul_B!(C, A, B)
    @avx for n ∈ indices((C,B), 2), m ∈ indices((C,A), 1)
        Cmn = zero(eltype(C))
        for k ∈ indices((A,B), (2,1))
            Cmn += C[m,k] * B[k,n]
        end
        C[m,n] = Cmn
    end
end

julia> A_mul_B!(A3, A1, A2)

julia> A3
2×2 Matrix{Float64}:
 6.22527e-310  9.15541e-310
 6.22543e-310  9.15553e-310

text:
ah yes, this line is wrong
`Cmn += A[m,k] * B[k,n]`

elements.text: ah yes, this line is wrong

text: Ah, yes, `C[m,k] * B[k,n]`.
I made PR with that one line fix :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: I made PR with that one line fix

text: Thanks for catching it, merged it!

elements.text: Thanks for catching it, merged it!

text: I was a bit disappointed that it wasn't faster than BLAS on my matrix size :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text: I was a bit disappointed that it wasn't faster than BLAS on my matrix size

text: denormals will do that
What's your matrix size?
Very tall and skinny. I'm curious how it does.

text: let me run a benchmark
What's the inner product size?
(I'm guessing `J` is the result?)
(if benchmarking, also make sure they use the same number of threads)

text: Ah. Mind trying Octavian?
`A' * B` is the worst combination of transposes for LoopVectorization, as you can see in the benchmarks

elements.text: is the worst combination of transposes for LoopVectorization, as you can see in the benchmarks

text:
```julia> J = rand(190459, 45); C = Matrix{Float64}(undef, 45,45);

julia> using Octavian, LinearAlgebra; BLAS.set_num_threads(1);

julia> @benchmark mul!($C, $J', $J)
BenchmarkTools.Trial:
  memory estimate:  0 bytes
  allocs estimate:  0
  --------------
  minimum time:     12.525 ms (0.00% GC)
  median time:      12.566 ms (0.00% GC)
  mean time:        12.572 ms (0.00% GC)
  maximum time:     13.017 ms (0.00% GC)
  --------------
  samples:          398
  evals/sample:     1

julia> @benchmark Octavian.matmul_serial!($C, $J', $J)
BenchmarkTools.Trial:
  memory estimate:  0 bytes
  allocs estimate:  0
  --------------
  minimum time:     15.261 ms (0.00% GC)
  median time:      15.297 ms (0.00% GC)
  mean time:        15.297 ms (0.00% GC)
  maximum time:     15.408 ms (0.00% GC)
  --------------
  samples:          327
  evals/sample:     1```

text: Octavian?
that is new ...
<https://github.com/JuliaLinearAlgebra/Octavian.jl>
I plan on eventually incoporating all the optimizations it does into LoopVectorization, for for now it (a) handles large matrices much better

elements.text: I plan on eventually incoporating all the optimizations it does into LoopVectorization, for for now it (a) handles large matrices much better

text: and (b) handles `A' * B` much better.
It was still slower for me.

elements.text: It was still slower for me.

text: What about Tullio?
Tullio does cache optimizations as well, but for matrix multiplication specifically, Octavian should be faster.

elements.text: Tullio does cache optimizations as well, but for matrix multiplication specifically, Octavian should be faster.

text: Your CPU seems twice as fast as mine

text:
My CPU has AVX512:
```julia> versioninfo()
Julia Version 1.7.0-DEV.873
Commit ab6652ab9a* (2021-04-08 11:17 UTC)
Platform Info:
  OS: Linux (x86_64-generic-linux)
  CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-10980XE CPU @ 3.00GHz```

elements.text:
julia> versioninfo()
Julia Version 1.7.0-DEV.873
Commit ab6652ab9a* (2021-04-08 11:17 UTC)
Platform Info:
  OS: Linux (x86_64-generic-linux)
  CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-10980XE CPU @ 3.00GHz

text: ah, that is why! AVX512
(with 2 fma units. It's also close to twice as fast per core as my laptop per core at matrix multiplication, because the "consumer" (non-HEDT/server) chips have just 1 fma)

elements.text: (with 2 fma units. It's also close to twice as fast per core as my laptop per core at matrix multiplication, because the "consumer" (non-HEDT/server) chips have just 1 fma)

text: But cool that Octavian matched OpenBLAS on your CPU
